hints.label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
hints.title: Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
hints.content:
7340: :label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
7341: 
7342: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
7343: 
7344: $$
7345: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b
7346: $$
7347: 
7348: Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:
7349: 
7350: $$
7351: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0
7352: $$
hints.raw_directive:
7337: ## 11.3. Main Theorem: Boundary Potential Contraction
7338: 
7339: :::{prf:theorem} Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
7340: :label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
7341: 
7342: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
7343: 
7344: $$
7345: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b
7346: $$
7347: 
7348: Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:
7349: 
7350: $$
7351: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0
7352: $$

hints.label: rem-progressive-safety
hints.title: Interpretation: Progressive Safety Enhancement
hints.content:
7358: :label: rem-progressive-safety
7359: 
7360: This theorem formalizes the Safe Harbor mechanism:
7361: 
7362: - **When many walkers are near the boundary** ($W_b$ large), these walkers have low fitness and high cloning probability
7363: - **They are replaced by clones of interior walkers**, pulling the boundary potential down
7364: - **The contraction rate $\kappa_b$ is state-independent**, ensuring consistent safety correction regardless of swarm configuration
7365: - **The bounded offset $C_b$** accounts for walkers entering the boundary region through position jitter, but this is dominated by contraction when $W_b$ is large
7366: 
7367: **Important Consequences:**
